name: Latika Roy Memorial Foundation Society
briefDescription: Latika Roy Memorial Foundation (LRF), registered under the Societies Act of 1860, has been a force for inclusion in North India for nearly 25 years. Founded in 1994 and based out of Dehra Dun, the organization works with children and young adults with disabilities. The Foundation provides creative diagnostics, education and therapy to children and adults focusing on those that fall financially and socially outside the reach of mainstream education and support services.Key Areas of WorkAssessment, Early Intervention, Education & Therapy, Vocational Skills, Training, Inclusion, Advocacy, Awareness, Follow-up and Research.On an everyday basis we;-	Assess approximately 3 new children (~1000 annually) and provide therapy, education and opportunities to over 260 children every day-	Follow-up with over 500 children and families annually-	Ensure that our graduates with varying forms of developmental disabilities find employment and be contributing citizens in the society-	Sensitize almost 5000 people annually through training, workshops, awareness and outreach initiatives to remote locations across Uttarakhand-	Support people with disabilities in accessing government programs including disability certificates, pensions, legal redressals, medical services and employmentTotal Number of people served in the last 5 years = 15000
